snippet: The secretary of state said he believed that if President Bashar al-Assad was carefully removed, America, Russia and Syria’s rebel forces could easily defeat the Islamic State.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry says Islamic State could be defeated in months if world leaders could agree on cleanly removing Syrian president Bashar al-Assad from power; asserts success would require negotiating cease-fire, including elusive agreement over status of rebel groups, and military effort led by 'indigenous' ground troops.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Nicosia, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The secretary of state said he believed that if President Bashar al-Assad was carefully removed, America, Russia and Syria’s rebel forces could easily defeat the Islamic State.

headline.main: To Crush ISIS, John Kerry Urges Deft Removal of Syria’s Assad
headline.print_headline: Kerry Urges Deft Removal of Assad to Crush ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
